channel.title: Tartarus | From the beginning
channel.description:
[center]
[shadow=black,left][size=18pt]Tartarus-Online[/size][/shadow] [size=10pt][b]From the beginning[/b][/size]
[url=http://]Website[/url] | [url=http://]Twitter[/url] | [url=http://]Facebook[/url] | [url=http://]YouTube[/url] [/center]
[hr]
[b]Introduction:[/b] Hey guys. This is the all new installation to the RSPS community by myself and my fellow team members which I'm sure you all know ;). First I'll introduce the motives and ethics on which Tartarus revolves around. Tartarus is a server first and foremost run by the players. Just because we have a golden crown doesn't mean anything other than we're devoted to keeping the server to your specifications. We are primarily here to please the players, this will never change. We have our hosting situations solved and our domain and what not has been purchased, due to the general ages of our development team we for the most part have jobs and can pay for things if needed. Money is not an object when you come to Tartarus, we will make sure that our players have a nice, fun and clean environment to spend their online time in. Tartarus will be written from scratch by our two server developers who are experienced in their fields. Our client will be developed by someone who has a very high presence in and around the client section of this forum and of course, the website will be developed and created by myself. Check the team section of this post for more information on who those people are, also; continually check this thread for updates regarding Tartarus!
[b]Team:[/b]
[ul][li][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=534060]Ruby[/url][/li][list] [li]Website Developer/Administrator[/li][/list] [li][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=343434]the elve age[/url][/li][list] [li]Client Developer/Administrator[/li][/list] [li][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=288011]deathschaos9[/url][/li][list] [li]Server Developer/Administrator[/li][/list] [li][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=490965]Clawz fury[/url][/li][list] [li]Server Developer/Administrator[/li][/list][/ul]
[b]Media:[/b] Considering this project was only just started there isn't really much to show, especially since this is being written from scratch. We can however redirect you to [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,570644.0.html]the thread[/url] that the elve age created for his client beforehand, you can see some of the updates he made there.
Proof of concept picture! [img]http://oi49.tinypic.com/2cxj03n.jpg[/img]
[b]Recent Updates:[/b] [code] BEFORE PROJECT: Adding character equipment support Yellow tooltips for interfaces Better renaming Improved shadowing Fixing missing lines on the minimap 100k/m/b Enter amount No blank username login Fixing the online/offline "glitch" Removed flames/RS Logo Adding "loading - please wait" Item dragging Lava texture fixing 474 Model support Highly improved interfaces Figured out the character clothing method, added more colors Added 474 animations/maps Figured out how the 377 client implements headicons and add it to my client
GROUP: Assembled, server ethics discussed etc.
10th Feb 2013: Domain bought Site started development
13th Feb 2013: Framework development started Few interface bugs were wiped in the client
14th Feb 2013: Networking base complete Login protocol complete [/code]
[b]Extras:[/b] This thread will continually be updated to fit the project and what not, since both deathschaos9 and the elve age can edit the thread as they see fit. I'm also not going to include the link to the website or anything such as that e.g the twitter link and what not before it's all complete and ready to launch. However, be sure to see them crop up very soon!
[hr]
Regards, Tartarus Development Team

item.title: Tartarus | From the beginning
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

[quote="Discardedx2, post:41, topic:483889"]Lol John you’re still around here eh?

Good luck with this but I’d like you to clear up what you mean by “Buffer oriented NIO vs stream oriented IO”, obviously NIO is different than IO (it’s asynchronous) but buffer vs stream orientation does not sound correct at all.[/quote]

io is stream oriented as opposed to nio which is buffer oriented so i don’t see why this doesn’t sound correct.

Read full topic

item.title: Tartarus | From the beginning
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote="Discardedx2, post:41, topic:483889"]Lol John you’re still around here eh?

Good luck with this but I’d like you to clear up what you mean by “Buffer oriented NIO vs stream oriented IO”, obviously NIO is different than IO (it’s asynchronous) but buffer vs stream orientation does not sound correct at all.

Also disregard sinisoul… completely[/quote]

I find myself coming here less and less but yes Shawn, despite college and an acquired social life I still come here.

Anywho, it is my understanding that Java’s standard io (java.io) mainly uses data streams whereas Java NIO (java.nio) uses buffers. That being said I/O is still not my forte and I could obviously be wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Tartarus | From the beginning
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Fails, post:38, topic:483889”]I haven’t been keeping up with this project, not that it really matters seeing as you all have more than enough support. :o

From here on out, I will check this thread daily to see what new and exciting updates have been implemented.

Once again, good luck guys.[/quote]
You should be seeing a lot more updates coming out of this now that we’ve abandoned the scratch server idea and went with rs377d. Content will be flying out in no time, thanks for the continued support everyone

Read full topic

@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

I haven’t been keeping up with this project, not that it really matters seeing as you all have more than enough support. :o

Once again, good luck guys.

item.title: Tartarus | From the beginning
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:36, topic:483889”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=602125.msg4230210#msg4230210 date=1361218643]

Writing from scratch sucks

Try do it a million times before you actually get it past the “crap” stage.

What I learned from writing scratch: It’s better then using every other crap server out there. Its a total waste of your time and leeching is just whats best!

@Ruby
Login only takes 10 minutes of coding sadly. Get the team to work harder!
[/quote]

Yes it only takes a few minutes to set up a simple socket and add the login protocol, but I was aiming for more advanced networking for optimization of the server and as a learning experience for myself.

That being said I’ve drastically underestimated my free time leaving my framework underdeveloped and to continue with it would set this project behind for quite some time. As we are all eager to start developing actual content we are most likely going to use Blakeman’s rs377d framework which can be found here.[/quote]
Sucks to hear how busy you are, but it was good that you tried to go above and beyond the regular work for it. Good luck on the rest of the project!

Read full topic

item.title: Tartarus | From the beginning
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:28, topic:483889”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=602125.msg4228829#msg4228829 date=1361141527]
Writing from scratch sucks
[/quote]
Try do it a million times before you actually get it past the “crap” stage.

What I learned from writing scratch: It’s better then using every other crap server out there. Its a total waste of your time and leeching is just whats best!

@Ruby
Login only takes 10 minutes of coding sadly. Get the team to work harder![/quote]

Yes it only takes a few minutes to set up a simple socket and add the login protocol, but I was aiming for more advanced networking for optimization of the server and as a learning experience for myself.

That being said I’ve drastically underestimated my free time leaving my framework underdeveloped and to continue with it would set this project behind for quite some time. As we are all eager to start developing actual content we are most likely going to use Blakeman’s rs377d framework which can be found here.

Read full topic

Looks interesting, will keep an eye on this project and its development.

Please do!

Writing from scratch sucks

Try do it a million times before you actually get it past the “crap” stage.

What I learned from writing scratch: It’s better then using every other crap server out there. Its a total waste of your time and leeching is just whats best!

@Ruby
Login only takes 10 minutes of coding sadly. Get the team to work harder!

I can’t make them replace their educations and jobs with Tartarus, we work when we can :P. We’re not in a rush.

Writing from scratch sucks

Try do it a million times before you actually get it past the “crap” stage.

What I learned from writing scratch: It’s better then using every other crap server out there. Its a total waste of your time and leeching is just whats best!

@Ruby
Login only takes 10 minutes of coding sadly. Get the team to work harder!

Hi, you must be new here.

Don’t really think I’ve ever laughed so much so far this month.

If only rep was still around.[/quote]
It does. Just go rep++ and I’m sure someone is keeping count ;). I love it when people downplay coding and Sini comes to the rescue to shut them down.
